title: String Compression II
content:
Run-length encoding is a string compression method that works by replacing consecutive identical characters (repeated 2 or more times) with the concatenation of the character and the number marking the count of the characters (length of the run). For example, to compress the string  we replace  by  and replace  by . Thus the compressed string becomes 
Notice that in this problem, we are not adding  after single characters.
Given a string  and an integer . You need to delete at most  characters from  such that the run-length encoded version of  has minimum length.
Find the minimum length of the run-length encoded version of  after deleting at most  characters.
 






 




 contains only lowercase English letters.
